intro: Tephrosia subpraecox, commonly known as the early flowering tephrosia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and has pinnately arranged leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds. Tephrosia subpraecox is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
